conclusion: Cars A and B are traveling in the same direction on a straight road. Their v-t graphs are shown in the figure. It is known that the two cars are side by side at t=30s.
In the v-t graph, Car A has a constant velocity of 40 m/s from t=0s to t=30s.
In the v-t graph, Car B starts from rest and accelerates uniformly, reaching a velocity of 40 m/s at t=30s.

premise: In a v-t graph, the area enclosed by the curve and the coordinate axes represents the displacement.
conclusion: The displacements of the two cars from 10 s to 30 s are equal.

premise: The displacements of the two cars from 10 s to 30 s are equal. The two cars are side by side at t=30s.
conclusion: The two cars are also side by side at t=10s.
